content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Autenticazione a 2 fattori
creator: @next

content:
linusr said
Hi, tbird 128.5.2esr w11p. Is there a way to archive gmail? There is no gmail acct in archives. And, if an archive for gmail can be created, can it be local only? I want to clear the inbox of old stuff but save it (locally). Also,I don't know if this is the right forum for this ques. pls move if nec. Thank you.

The short answer is no.

Gmail archives to its own all mail folder. Your best bet in my opinion is use Google takeout to archive all mail be label and subsequently import that to Thunderbird as the MBOX format used is compatible with Thunderbird. How to delete all your mail I have no idea. Gmail tends to make that hard.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Have you tried clicking on that triangle to see why the program is complaining about the address. My guess is it is already in Thunderbird, but it really would be good to check what Thunderbird is trying to tell you.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: I solved the problem by moving the B of Bruce all the way to the left. Bruce is my middle name and because I first set up some accounts using my first name, Thunderbird placed that first name in the "Your Full Name" each time I set up those previous email accounta. I went back after awhile and and imagined that the B of Bruce might be a a character space to the right of where it should be, corrected it and the setup was flawless!

Entrambe le cose non dipendono comunque da Thunderbird che ti sta solo mostrando il messaggio di errore che riceve dal server.

content:
Bonjour,

que se passe-t-il quand tu lances Thunderbird ? Un message d'erreur? Au démarrage de Thunderbird vois-tu une page comme dans ma copie d'écran, avec une invitation de "configurer votre adresse e-mail existante" ?
creator: Mapenzi

content: Yes, it is attempting to assist you in that. You need to have already secured an email account and thunderbird will assist in entering the proper information for server and security options. I notice you have a gmail account. Enter your name, the email address, do NOT enter the password and that will be sufficient for thunderbird (usually) to set up the account. Since Gmail also requires that thunderbird accept cookes, check in settings>privacy&security that cookies are accepted. Or, just enter the email info and press enter key. Reminder: do not enter password until you get a Google popup that asks for it. Let us know if you have problems.

content:
Hi Gay,

You have to create an app-specific password for Thunderbird and use that to allow Thunderbird to access your iCloud mail. Apple does not allow apps to access iCloud mail without this permission.

Sign in here to get started:

https://account.apple.com

Good luck.

Rick

content: If all the emails from the person are in the same folder then you would sort the emails by sender, then use the Shift+click function to save all between the first and last, then move all the highlighted to where you want them to be.
creator: arlev

content:
Holà,

you can use the Thunderbird "Quick Filter" function. By default the Quick Filter button will be displayed on the right just above thread pane. A simple click will display the Quick Filter bar above the thread pane. Fill in a sender name in its search bar and in the line "Filter messages by: " unselect all buttons except the "Sender" button. You'll see the results of your search for a sender displayed in the thread pane. You can delete all results or move them to another folder or whatever you want to do....
creator: Mapenzi

content: Translation - Dear Ladies and Gentlemen, As a long-time user of your email program, I would like to ask for your support in solving the following problem: I have been using Norton 360 PREMIUM as security software for years; Domain and email address are from strato. This always worked without any problems, even after I authenticated the SSL settings a few months ago according to your recommendation. But when installing Norton Safe Email, which is now recommended by Norton, the blocking message "This email provider is not supported" appeared after entering my email address, so that the final download of the new program component was not possible. So I turned to Symantec Norton and got the answer: "I'm really sorry to inform you that your email address does not support our Norton Safe Email because your email provider is not compatible with our Norton Safe Email program." Can I fix the problem in the account settings or what do you recommend I do? I ask you to help me solve the problem [personal info removed]. First of all, thank you very much and best regards! Roland Buchwald
creator: arlev

content: Thunderbird can do nothing to please a separate software's unknown expectations. All I can suggest is to share this with your email provider and possibly inquire to Norton what their requirements are. Is this a self-hosted site? If so, check with the host to see if there might be a more secure setting.. I would also try sending email with Norton turned off to first verify that the account works.
creator: davidsk

content: Use Ctrl+R for the time being until you resolve the problem.

content:
probably just not waiting long enough for the image to complete downloading. My boss keeps complaining about SMS or MMS messages having low quality images and they are because he is viewing them on his phone immediately the message is received and the software starts displaying the image before the whole image file is downloaded. Perhaps the same is happening here?

I can see no way for Thunderbird, without the help of third party products like an antivirus scanner or an addon to "shrink" images, to reduce the image to anything but what it is. You click attach and the file is converted to MIME encoded text the same as it has been for the last 20 or 30 years, when the recipients get the email the MIME text is converted back into an image.
creator: MattAuSupport

creator: dmk542

content:
Mostly we find these incessant update requests do not originate in Thunderbird. It is a new feature of some antivirus programs to prompt for software updates. I have no idea how they do that, what I do know is they are quite prone to getting in wrong.

The small number that are actually requiring an update and for some reason not getting the update actually installed are also cause mostly caused by antivirus programs. The update tries to install new files and the bumbling antivirus prevents that with it's scanning.

If you are seeing a trend in my answer you would be correct. Antivirus is probably the greatest cause of failure in Thunderbird doing it's job. It is also the application that routinely asks you to stick a great hole in your encrypted communications so it can scan.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: You can isolate the suspicious IMAP account by removing it temporarily without removing the message data. It would be very interesting to know the size of the INBOX folder in the suspîcious account.
